whatr 0.4.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Return the right J! Archive HTML document

Source: R/whatr-html.R
whatr_html.Rd

To avoid downloading and reading the J! Archive over and over, this function can be used to return an HTML document from one of four types of input:

  1. Game ID (6304)

  2. Show number ("#8006")

  3. Air date ("2019-06-03")

  4. HTML document itself

whatr_html(x, out = c("showgame", "showscores"))

Arguments

x

Any kind of J! Archive game identifier.
out

One of "showscores" or "showgame" used for whatr_scores() or whatr_clues(), etc. respectively. Either document can be returned from the input of the other.

Value

A J! Archive html_document.

Examples

whatr_html(x = 6304, out = "showscores")
#> {html_document}
#> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="en">
#> [1] <head>\n<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8 ...
#> [2] <body>\n\n<div id="navbar">\n  <span id="navbarlogo"><a href="http://www. ...
whatr_html(x = "2019-06-03", out = "showgame")
#> {html_document}
#> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="en">
#> [1] <head>\n<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8 ...
#> [2] <body>\n\n<div id="navbar">\n  <span id="navbarlogo"><a href="http://www. ...
whatr_html("#8006", "showgame") %>% whatr_clues()
#> # A tibble: 61 x 5
#>    round   col   row     n clue                                                 
#>    <int> <int> <int> <int> <chr>                                                
#>  1     1     1     1    25 For An Optimistic View Of Things, Take A Look Throug…
#>  2     1     2     1    26 Melville's 'Bartleby The Scrivener' Is Subtitled 'A …
#>  3     1     3     1    27 Ahoy!  It's A Lookout Perch Atop A High Mast         
#>  4     1     4     1    28 'Escape To Margaritaville':Him                       
#>  5     1     5     1    29 'The American People Don't Believe Anything's Real U…
#>  6     1     6     1    30 I'm Not A Cook, But I Can Sure Toast Up These Kellog…
#>  7     1     1     2    24 If You Have These, It Means You're Well-Organized    
#>  8     1     2     2    23 In A 1923 Book By Kahlil Gibran, Almustafa Is This M…
#>  9     1     3     2    22 Made In A Series Of Varying Sizes To Fit One Inside …
#> 10     1     4     2    21 'Jersey Boys':Them                                   
#> # … with 51 more rows
